intro: Escobaria laredoi, commonly known as Laredo's liveforever, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico and the southwestern United States. The plant is a low-growing shrub with dense, woolly foliage and produces yellow flowers in the spring. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. Escobaria laredoi is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
